measured_by: drift rate (v) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: The article notes that "the rate at which evidence is accumulated is represented by the drift rate parameter, which can be thought of as co-determined by the sensitivity of perceiver" and later describes drift as "a more sensitive measure of participant capability."

measured_by: boundary separation (a) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: It states that the "decision boundary separation… reflects the conservativeness of the participant's decision criterion; higher boundaries produce slower but more accurate responses," directly tying the construct to the boundary parameter.

measured_by: starting point (z) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: The paper defines "z, the starting point of accumulation… which biases the response based on pre-stimulus expectations," indicating that response bias is indexed by the z parameter.

measured_by: non-decision time (Ter) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: The parameter list includes "Ter, non-decision time, a fixed delay which does not vary with stimulus information," identifying Ter as the measure of non-decision processes.
